definition: to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

sentences.english: Dr. Chen is a leading scientist in ecology.
sentences.chinese: 陳博士是生態學上首屈一指的科學家。

sentences.english: Destination China is one of the finest Destination Management Companies in China.
sentences.chinese: 北京紫都國旅是中國首屈一指的接待公司。

sentences.english: Bostonian education cause is matchless in USA.
sentences.chinese: 波士頓的教育事業在美國首屈一指。

sentences.english: Tall, project of the grand, in the Heze area come first on the list.
sentences.chinese: 高大，工程之宏偉，在菏澤地區首屈一指。

sentences.english: The company is a world leader in electrical goods.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司的電器產品在全世界首屈一指。

sentences.english: Oceania point will be Malaysia, dry reach second to none in coastal development.
sentences.chinese: 金海灣將成爲馬來西亞依斯干達首屈一指的海濱發展。

sentences.english: He was first and foremost a fiery orator in the 19th century mold.
sentences.chinese: 他卻是19世紀中期首屈一指的富於熱情的雄辯家。

sentences.english: Asia Star is Hong Kong's first six-star "cruise hotel at sea".
sentences.chinese: 亞洲之星被譽爲香港首屈一指的六星級的海上酒店。

sentences.english: ISTAN has become the leading retail group in Japan dealing with general merchandise.
sentences.chinese: 歷程現在伊勢丹已成爲日本首屈一指的零售業集團。

sentences.english: In the forefront of all results.
Fairchild Semiconductor (NYSE:FCS) is the leading global supplier of high-performance power products.
sentences.chinese: 飛兆半導體是全球首屈一指的高性能功率產品供貨商。

sentences.english: Kim by Couple.net, one of the leading matchmaking agencies in South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 佳偶網絡公司是韓國首屈一指的婚介機構。

sentences.english: To the best campaign team ever assembled in the history of politics.
sentences.chinese: 我要感謝政治史上首屈一指的競選班子。

sentences.english: The courage and professionalism of our armed forces are second to none.
sentences.chinese: 我軍的勇氣和敬業精神是世界上首屈一指的。

sentences.english: Yes, of course. Their music is the best in this country.
sentences.chinese: 當然了，他們的音樂選曲是全國首屈一指的。

sentences.english: Mengfu Zhao was one of the most distinguished artists in Yuan dynasty of China.
sentences.chinese: 趙孟頫是元代首屈一指的大畫家。

definition: reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
to be considered as outstanding or special/to be reckoned with/notable
peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
second only to.../(in second place) preceded only by...
